disobedience.question: Did you reject the unity of the Church when feeling frustrated with others due to their imperfections, while Christ prayed for all to be one?
disobedience.description: Rejecting Church unity due to frustration with individuals is sinful because it confuses the Church's divine nature and eternal truths with the human imperfections of its members, while also violating Christ's prayer "that they may all be one."

disobedience.question: Did I reject unity among Church members when disagreeing with others within?
disobedience.description: Rejecting Church unity due to frustration with individuals is sinful because it confuses the Church's divine nature and eternal truths with the human imperfections of its members, while also violating Christ's prayer "that they may all be one."

disobedience.question: Did I publicly speak disrespectfully against the Church?
disobedience.description: Mocking the church shows contempt for Christ's established institution on earth, disrespects the Body of Christ, and undermines the Church's divine authority as guided by the Holy Spirit.

blasphemy.question: Did you receive Holy Communion while being aware that your heart was not in a right disposition to partake in it?
blasphemy.description: This mortal sin is a form of sacrilege and profanes the real presence of Christ and shows grave disrespect for the sacrament by receiving unworthily.

blasphemy.question: Did you receive Holy Communion while knowingly having an attachment to sinful habits that profane God's presence?
blasphemy.description: This mortal sin is a form of sacrilege and profanes the real presence of Christ and shows grave disrespect for the sacrament by receiving unworthily.

vainglory.question: Am I more focused on defending my online reputation and gaining likes, comments, and followers than pleasing God?
vainglory.description: Vainglory corrupts our good actions by doing them for human acclaim rather than for God's glory, making us slaves to others' opinions rather than true servants of God.

extracted_data_phrases: on impressing others through my online presence than pleasing God
vainglory.question: Am I more focused on impressing others through my online presence than pleasing God?
vainglory.description: Vainglory corrupts our good actions by doing them for human acclaim rather than for God's glory, making us slaves to others' opinions rather than true servants of God.

in online communities , social events , and everyday life
ambition.question: Did you let your desire for power and dominance influence how you interacted with others in online communities, social events, and everyday life?
ambition.description: inordinate ambition and the obsession with power corrupts the soul by placing our desire to dominate and control above God's authority, turning us away from humble service and toward prideful self-exaltation.

ambition.description: inordinate ambition and the obsession with power corrupts the soul by placing our desire to dominate and control above God's authority, turning us away from humble service and toward prideful self-exaltation.

extracted_data_phrases: of career advancement and leadership roles
ambition.question: Did my pursuit of career advancement and leadership roles allow me to prioritize power over people, influencing my decisions and treatment of others?
ambition.description: inordinate ambition and the obsession with power corrupts the soul by placing our desire to dominate and control above God's authority, turning us away from humble service and toward prideful self-exaltation.

greed.question: Did I make accumulating wealth, possessions, and material comfort my primary driving force in life?
greed.description: This sin makes money an idol that replaces trust in God's providence, turning what should be a tool for good into an object of worship.

oppression.question: Did you use your authority, position, or influence to mistreat, harass, or discriminate against others?
oppression.description: It's a sin to execute an unjust and cruel exercise of power or authority over others instead of respecting the God-given dignity of every human person.

extracted_data_phrases: by engaging in unjust or cruel behavior , especially through your online interactions
oppression.question: Did you mistreat or harass others by engaging in unjust or cruel behavior, especially through your online interactions, or when exercising authority over those under your care?
oppression.description: It's a sin to execute an unjust and cruel exercise of power or authority over others instead of respecting the God-given dignity of every human person.

envy.question: Have I resented the accomplishments of others, wishing they would lose what they have achieved?
envy.description: Envy leads us to have discontent for another's possessions so we won't feel the pain of comparison or perceived lack in our own lives.

incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

incontinence.question: Did I lack self-control and use unseemly language that disrespected others in our online interactions?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

impiety.question: Did you engage in work on a Sunday, when otherwise it could have been avoided?
impiety.description: It's irreverent to work on a Sunday as it's a holy day of rest, worship, and a day of protest against the servitude of work and the worship of money (CCC).

anger.question: Have I nursed anger in my thoughts toward others, rather than seeking reconciliation?
anger.description: Uncontrolled anger corrupts our own heart, damages our relationship with both God and neighbor.
